page.title: 17Taliaris Park Mansion.
page.content: {TALIARIS PARK}mansion is situated ref. 27/64. It stands on a site dated pre- 1630. The mansion has two Renaissance sides which were refaced in the second half of the 18th cent.Originally built for the Gwynne family, it later came into the ownership of the Peel family, close relatives of the statesman Sir Robert Peel. Although currently owned by Mr.& Mrs.John Spencer Williams, the Dower Cottage remains the property of the Peel family. The interior of the house contains elaborate plaster work, pine panelling, a beautiful Jacobean 'dog-leg' staircase,and some fine 17th century wall and ceiling paintings of Italian influence. In the courtyard is a cockpit, and a Georgian cottage wing now converted into flats. The estate retains little of its original Park except for the immediate outbuildings, lawns, and the walled gardens .
